result.execSummary:
The defendant Leonardo Hernandez-Rico was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Court does not object tranfer to IL.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all of following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. All costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge; all applicable fees of supervision. 
*Restitution set at zero.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of ilegal drugs/alcohol.
If defendant successfully completes probation, including all financial obligations met, and if the defendant is eligible, the Court would consider a motion for expungement.
Follow all rules of supervision. Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment. Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leonardo Hernandez-Rico

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: NOTICE OF FAILURE TO MEET CONDITIONS FOR EXPUNGEMENT RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO JUNE S. OS

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING commencing JULY 2, 2015 received and filed. (22 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to DARRYL SMITH 819 N. 6TH ST

PSI reviewed and corrections made.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 2 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 1 YEAR probation.  Court does not object to transfer to IL.

  Conditions of Probation:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution set at zero; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 

If defendant successfully complete probation (including all financial obligations met) and if the defendant is eligible, the court would consider a motion for expungement.

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Leonardo Hernandez-Rico in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Leonardo Hernandez-Rico in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Plea/sentencing hearing, however defense recently retained Atty Reddin, who requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Leonardo Hernandez-Rico in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn. David Robles on behalf of Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty. Date given by clerk in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court continued the signature bond that was previously signed in the county jail.

ADDRESS INFO for Leonardo Hernandez-Rico
Current: 1772 N Rose Ave, Palentine, IL   (Effective: 03-25-2015)
Prior: 217 Midway Drive, Mundelein, IL 60060

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kohls Department Store located at S 76th Street.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Leonardo Hernandez-Rico in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Christopher J. Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES  QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/25/15 @ 1:30pm
